intro: Cryptolepis grandiflora, commonly known as the African snake plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its upright, succulent-like stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in low-light conditions. Cryptolepis grandiflora is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
